page.title: 16PLANTS
page.content: FROM EARLY SPRING ONWARDS THE AREA HAS A SUCCESSION OF WILD FLOWERS. ON THE SLOPES OF{MEDNIP} COWSLIPS AND ORCHIDS BLOOM.THE MOORS ARE THE HABITAT OF MANY WETLAND PLANTS INCLUDING THE YELLOW FLAGS, WATER VIOLETS, ARROWHEAD, WATER PLANTAIN AND BULL- RUSHES. RAGGED ROBIN AND MEADOW CRANESBILL ARE UNCOMMON FIELD FLOWERS AND FALSE CYPERUS GROWS BY THE RHINES. TREES ARE MAINLY MIXED DECIDUOUS AND IN {DRAYCOTT}THERE ARE SEVERAL LARGE WALNUT TREES, ONE HAVING A PRESERVATION ORDER. EVERYWHERE ARE MANY HAWTHORN TREES AND BUSHES. VARIOUS TYPES OF WILLOW GROW ON THE {MOORS.}THESE FLOWERS ATTRACT MANY BUTTERFLIES.DRAGON FLIES ARE COMMON AND FROGS CAN BE SEEN SPAWNING IN SPRING. HARES ARE OFTEN SEEN AND BADGERS INHABIT THE AREA CAUSING DAMAGE TO CROPS.
